name: nytimes
text:
Changes at school will start as soon as students leave home: Bus rides won’t look the same.

A typical bus carries 54 children. With social distancing, it might be 8.

Some might use a zig-zag pattern and masks to allow more students on board. https://t.co/NoOlga9knL https://t.co/HVmVqUDI0F

name: nytimes
text:
Schools in Marietta, Georgia, plan to spend $640,000 to hire 55 monitors to check students’ symptoms before they board buses.

Dundee, Michigan, expects to spend over $300,000 to add bus routes. https://t.co/NoOlga9knL https://t.co/wYGy8K9tTC

name: nytimes
text:
When students arrive at school, most will be checked to see if they are running a temperature or showing other symptoms.

If adults are dropping off children, they will likely remain behind a barrier. https://t.co/NoOlga9knL https://t.co/OxLReuDcPD

name: nytimes
text:
Once students are inside, classrooms will also look very different.  

One goal is to keep children in self-contained pods that could be quarantined if someone tests positive, without affecting the rest of the school. https://t.co/NoOlga9knL https://t.co/MFK11XKym1

name: nytimes
text:
Some schools will use X’s to show students where to sit for story time.

Teachers may also use clear face shields i… https://t.co/zuGDHH18Yk

name: nytimes
text: In middle and high schools, students who normally move between classrooms during the day will remain in self-contai… https://t.co/xjbY6OcwL3

name: nytimes
text:
Desks may have plastic shields, in addition to being placed according to social distancing guidelines.

Some students could be learning online even while in a classroom in order to access more advanced material. https://t.co/NoOlga9knL https://t.co/SGdXuugjRf

name: nytimes
text:
Schools are not planning to follow a traditional bell schedule. 

Instead, individual pods of students will travel through unidirectional hallways at specific times, including, in some cases, for pre-scheduled bathroom breaks. https://t.co/NoOlga9knL https://t.co/0LFgsY8Sqa

name: nytimes
text:
In some countries, schools that reopened with similar guidelines have relaxed them as infections stayed low.

The U.S. is different: Some schools will try to reopen classrooms as infections in the area remain high.

See more of what schools may look like. https://t.co/NoOlga9knL
